pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
Add definitions, equivalent conditions, and basic properties of (locally) Noetherian schemes, following [Stacks](https://stacks.math.columbia.edu/tag/01OU).

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [6411fafb8c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13972/commits/6411fafb8c5985757dd2c663bc9da9eb0270ca45)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Noetherian`|1570|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsLocallyNoetherian`
`+ IsNoetherian`
`+ Scheme.isAffine_affineOpenCover`
`+ finite_irreducibleComponents_of_isNoetherian`
`+ iSup_affineOpens_eq_top`
`+ ideal_eq_iInf_comap_map_away`
`+ instance (priority := 100) IsLocallyNoetherian.quasiSeparatedSpace [IsLocallyNoetherian X] :`
`+ instance (priority := 100) IsNoetherian.noetherianSpace [IsNoetherian X] :`
`+ instance (priority := 100) quasiCompact_of_noetherianSpace_source {X Y : Scheme}`
`+ instance (priority := 100) {R : CommRingCat}`
`+ instance (priority := 100) {Z : Scheme} [IsLocallyNoetherian X]`
`+ instance {R} [CommRing R] [IsNoetherianRing R] :`
`+ isLocallyNoetherian_iff_of_affine_openCover`
`+ isLocallyNoetherian_iff_of_iSup_eq_top`
`+ isLocallyNoetherian_iff_openCover`
`+ isLocallyNoetherian_of_affine_cover`
`+ isLocallyNoetherian_of_isOpenImmersion`
`+ isNoetherianRing_of_away`
`+ isNoetherian_Spec`
`+ isNoetherian_iff_of_finite_affine_openCover`
`+ isNoetherian_iff_of_finite_iSup_eq_top`
`+ noetherianSpace_of_isAffine`
`+ noetherianSpace_of_isAffineOpen`
`+ Î“IsoTop`
`+++ instance {R : CommRingCat} [IsNoetherianRing R] :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

I should note that a couple of the proofs in the added file are quite long and unwieldy, and could definitely do with some cleaning up.

The docs also need fixing because the "main results" theorem names don't actually match up to the real theorems at the moment: will probably fix tomorrow.
By the way, if you have addressed all the comments, please change the `awaiting-author` tag to `awaiting-review`.
(you might need to merge master to get the new notations)
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

LGTM. Thanks for the contribution!
maintainer merge

Very nice work!
You might want to look at the library note [lower instance priority] and adjust accordingly.
Can you also add `IsLocallyNotherian` iff `IsLocallyNotherian` for an `OpenCover`?

Please merge master as some lemmas have changed names.
This mostly looks good now. I'll try to tidy up some proofs later in the week.
By the way, please use `Spec R` instead of `Scheme.Spec.obj (op R)`, and `Î“(X, U)` instead of `X.presheaf.obj (op U)`
Hopefully final round of comments.

LGTM. Thanks for the contribution!
maintainer merge
This does not belong here.
I've moved it to `RingTheory.Localization.Ideal` which seems like a better spot for it.
Can you make this an iff?

```suggestion
theorem finite_irreducibleComponents_of_isNoetherian [IsNoetherian X] :
```
This can be an instance.
You should make `IsNoetherian.compact` an instance.

```suggestion
  component_noetherian : âˆ€ (U : X.affineOpens),
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [â† ht] ```
This is just `iInf_subtype''`.

```suggestion
theorem isNoetherianRing_of_away : IsNoetherianRing R := by
```

```suggestion
    let f : â„• â†’o Ideal (Away (M := R) s) := 
      âŸ¨fun n => Ideal.map (floc s) (I n), by
        intro n m hnm
        dsimp
        apply Ideal.map_mono
        exact I.monotone hnmâŸ©
```

```suggestion
lemma iSup_affineOpens_eq_top : â¨† i : X.affineOpens, (i : Opens X) = âŠ¤ := by
```
This should go in `AffineScheme.lean`.
Other statements concerning unions should be changed to `iSup` of `Opens` too. This is how we usually state these. `of_affine_open_cover` is an outlier that should be changed.
You should give a version using `Scheme.OpenCover`.

```suggestion
    NoetherianSpace (Scheme.Spec.obj <| op R) := by
```

```suggestion
@[mk_iff]
class IsNoetherian (X : Scheme) extends
  IsLocallyNoetherian X, CompactSpace X : Prop where
```

```suggestion
    [IsNoetherian X] (f : X âŸ¶ Y) : QuasiCompact f :=
  âŸ¨fun _ _ _ => NoetherianSpace.isCompact _âŸ©
```

```suggestion
    IsLocallyNoetherian (Scheme.Spec.obj (op R)) := by
```
This should be called `isNoetherian_Spec` and be flipped.

```suggestion
    IsNoetherian (Scheme.Spec.obj (op R)) where
```
`TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis.sUnion_eq` and `Opens.ext` should get you almost there.

```suggestion
* `AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocallyNoetherian`: A scheme is locally Noetherian
```
Similar below.
This only needs `NoetherianSpace X`.

With the instance
```lean
instance (U : X.affineOpens) (r : Î“(X, U)) :
    IsLocalization.Away r Î“(X, X.basicOpen r) :=
  U.2.isLocalization_basicOpen r
```
This is just
```
intro U f hN
exact IsLocalization.isNoetherianRing (.powers f) Î“(X, X.basicOpen f) hN
```

Similarly this can be shortened into 
```
      have : IsNoetherianRing Î“(X, X.basicOpen f) := hN âŸ¨f, hfâŸ©
      apply isNoetherianRing_of_ringEquiv Î“(X, X.basicOpen f)
      have := IsLocalization.algEquiv (.powers f) (Localization.Away f) Î“(X, X.basicOpen f)
      exact this.symm.toRingEquiv
```

I believe the more useful version would be 
```
theorem isLocallyNoetherian_iff_of_iSup_eq_top
    (S : Set X.affineOpens) (â¨† i âˆˆ S, i : Opens X) = âŠ¤) :
     IsLocallyNoetherian X â†” âˆ€ U âˆˆ S, IsNoetherianRing Î“(X, U) :=
```
Same for this one.
And the universe should be `Scheme.OpenCover.{v, u} X`

```suggestion
theorem isLocallyNoetherian_of_openCover (C : Scheme.OpenCover.{v, u} X)
```
Does this work?

```suggestion
    let U : X.affineOpens := âŸ¨(m.app i).opensRange, by
      convert isAffineOpen_opensRange (m.app i)
      exact isAffine_Spec _âŸ©
```

```suggestion
    have hNoeth : IsNoetherianRing Î“(X, U) := by
```
I think we prefer `Î“(X, âŠ¤)` unless absolutely necessary.

```suggestion
  suffices f : Spec R â‰ƒâ‚œ X by
```
Maybe?

```suggestion
    IsNoetherian X â†” âˆ€ (i : C.J), IsNoetherianRing Î“(C.obj I, âŠ¤) := by
```

```suggestion
    S := {âŸ¨âŠ¤, isAffineOpen_top (Spec R)âŸ©})
```

```suggestion
  have := h.component_noetherian âŸ¨âŠ¤, isAffineOpen_top (Spec R)âŸ©
```

```suggestion
theorem iSup_affineOpens_eq_top (X : Scheme) : â¨† i : X.affineOpens, (i : Opens X) = âŠ¤ := by
```

```suggestion
  and quasi-compact as a topological space.
```
It seems that `R` is used only once, so that it is probably not necessary to declare it separately.
Here also, it seems `S` is used only once.
In some of the proofs below, you should use suitable indentation (and `Â·`) in order to highlight the hierarchy of the multiple goals.

```suggestion
  apply monotone_stabilizes_iff_noetherian.mp
```

```suggestion
      âŸ¨fun n â†¦ Ideal.map (floc s) (I n), fun _ _ h â†¦ Ideal.map_mono (I.monotone h)âŸ©
```
Please use `{Î¹} {S : Î¹ â†’ X.affineOpens}` instead, to provide a uniform interface to the API.

I've also golfed the proof
```
theorem isLocallyNoetherian_of_affine_cover {Î¹} {S : Î¹ â†’ X.affineOpens}
    (hS : (â¨† i, S i : Opens X) = âŠ¤)
    (hS' : âˆ€ i, IsNoetherianRing Î“(X, S i)) : IsLocallyNoetherian X := by
  refine âŸ¨fun U => ?_âŸ©
  induction U using of_affine_open_cover S hS with
  | basicOpen U f hN =>
    have := U.prop.isLocalization_basicOpen f
    exact IsLocalization.isNoetherianRing (.powers f) Î“(X, X.basicOpen f) hN
  | openCover U s _ hN =>
    apply isNoetherianRing_of_away s â€¹_â€º
    intro âŸ¨f, hfâŸ©
    have : IsNoetherianRing Î“(X, X.basicOpen f) := hN âŸ¨f, hfâŸ©
    have := U.prop.isLocalization_basicOpen f
    have hEq := IsLocalization.algEquiv (.powers f) (Localization.Away f) Î“(X, X.basicOpen f)
    exact isNoetherianRing_of_ringEquiv Î“(X, X.basicOpen f) hEq.symm.toRingEquiv
  | hU => exact hS' _
```

```suggestion
lemma noetherianSpace_of_isAffine [IsAffine X] [IsNoetherianRing Î“(X, âŠ¤)] :
```

```suggestion
    NoetherianSpace X :=
  (noetherianSpace_iff_of_homeomorph X.isoSpec.inv.homeomorph).mp inferInstance
```
(you might need to merge master for this)

```suggestion
  apply f.openEmbedding.toInducing.isCompact_preimage'
```

```suggestion
    Â· apply noetherianSpace_of_affineOpen âŸ¨U, hUâŸ©
      apply IsLocallyNoetherian.component_noetherian
    Â· exact Set.inter_subset_left
```
Please indent them when there are multiple subgoals.

```suggestion
lemma noetherianSpace_of_isAffineOpen (U : Opens X) (hU : IsAffineOpen U)
    [IsNoetherianRing Î“(X, U)] :
```
This is a more useful form IMO.

```suggestion
  have hInd := U.2.fromSpec.openEmbedding.toInducing
  apply (hInd.isCompact_preimage_iff ?_).mp
  Â· rw [â† Set.preimage_inter_range, IsAffineOpen.range_fromSpec, Set.inter_comm]
    apply hInd.isCompact_preimage'
    Â· apply (noetherianSpace_set_iff _).mp
      Â· apply noetherianSpace_of_affineOpen U
        apply IsLocallyNoetherian.component_noetherian
      Â· exact Set.inter_subset_left
    Â· rw [IsAffineOpen.range_fromSpec]
      exact Set.inter_subset_left
  Â· rw [IsAffineOpen.range_fromSpec]
    exact Set.inter_subset_left
```

Please use instance variables for typeclass arguments.
```suggestion
    [âˆ€ i, IsAffine (ð’°.obj i)] :
```
Can you move this near `IsOpenImmersion.Î“Iso` and mimic the proof there? Maybe call it `IsOpenImmersion.Î“TopIso`.

```suggestion
    Î“(U, âŠ¤) â‰… Î“(X, f.opensRange) := by
```

```suggestion
```
Can you add a unbundled version of this? (That is `instance {R} [CommRing R] [IsNoetherianRing R] : IsNoetherian (Spec (.of R))`)

```suggestion
    [Finite ð’°.J] [âˆ€ i, IsAffine (ð’°.obj i)] :
```

```suggestion
theorem isLocallyNoetherian_of_openCover (ð’° : Scheme.OpenCover.{v} X)
    [âˆ€ (i : ð’°.J), IsLocallyNoetherian (ð’°.obj i)] :
    IsLocallyNoetherian X := by
  rw [isLocallyNoetherian_iff_of_affine_openCover ð’°.affineRefinement.openCover]
  intro i
  exact @isNoetherianRing_of_ringEquiv _ _ _ _
    (Scheme.openImmersionÎ“ (Scheme.OpenCover.map _ i.2)).symm.commRingCatIsoToRingEquiv
    (IsLocallyNoetherian.component_noetherian âŸ¨_, isAffineOpen_opensRange _âŸ©)
```
This works for general universes.

```suggestion
  have : IsNoetherianRing Î“(X âˆ£_áµ¤ U, âŠ¤) := isNoetherianRing_of_ringEquiv _
    (X.restrictFunctorÎ“.app (op U)).symm.commRingCatIsoToRingEquiv
  exact @noetherianSpace_of_isAffine _ hU _
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
instance (priority := 100) IsNoetherian.noetherianSpace [IsNoetherian X] :
```

```suggestion
  apply IsLocallyNoetherian.component_noetherian
```

```suggestion
```
Is it possible to make this into an iff as well?
(According to the naming scheme, defs should be in camelCase. Here `Î“` is upper-case but this is an exception)

```suggestion
    Î“(X, âŠ¤) â‰… Î“(Y, f.opensRange) :=
  IsOpenImmersion.Î“Iso f âŠ¤ â‰ªâ‰« Y.presheaf.map (eqToIso (inf_top_eq f.opensRange)).op
```
Not tested. Might need a `.symm` somewhere.
In general, using tactic mode to construct data (`def`s) may give terms that are hard to work with.

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun _ => inferInstance,
   fun _ => inferInstanceâŸ©
```

```suggestion
theorem isLocallyNoetherian_iff_of_affine_openCover (ð’° : Scheme.OpenCover.{v, u} X)
```

Can you add
```
instance (ð’° : X.AffineOpenCover) (i) : IsAffine (ð’°.openCover.obj i) :=
  inferInstanceAs (IsAffine (Spec (ð’°.obj i)))
```
to `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.AffineScheme`? thanks. This will then be unnecessary.
Can you separate "if `X -> Y` is an open immersion and `Y` is locally noetherian, then so is `X`" from the => direction to a separate lemma?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): add locally Noetherian and Noetherian schemes

### PR summary [6411fafb8c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13972/commits/6411fafb8c5985757dd2c663bc9da9eb0270ca45)

#### Import changes for modified files

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsLocallyNoetherian`
`+ IsNoetherian`

`+ Î“IsoTop`
`+++ instance {R : CommRingCat} [IsNoetherianRing R] :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

I should note that a couple of the proofs in the added file are quite long and unwieldy, and could definitely do with some cleaning up.

The docs also need fixing because the "main results" theorem names don't actually match up to the real theorems at the moment: will probably fix tomorrow.

Very nice work!
You might want to look at the library note [lower instance priority] and adjust accordingly.
Can you also add `IsLocallyNotherian` iff `IsLocallyNotherian` for an `OpenCover`?
By the way, if you have addressed all the comments, please change the `awaiting-author` tag to `awaiting-review`.

Please merge master as some lemmas have changed names.
This mostly looks good now. I'll try to tidy up some proofs later in the week.
By the way, please use `Spec R` instead of `Scheme.Spec.obj (op R)`, and `Î“(X, U)` instead of `X.presheaf.obj (op U)`
(you might need to merge master to get the new notations)
Hopefully final round of comments.

LGTM. Thanks for the contribution!
